title: Task 46

question.text: What does debugging mean in the context of programming?

answers.feedback: Debugging is about fixing problems, not necessarily making a program run faster.
Debugging involves fixing existing features, not adding new ones.

answers.answer: Testing a program for the first time
answers.feedback: Debugging happens after initial tests to fix identified issues.

description:
Debugging is a common term in programming. It means finding and fixing problems or bugs in software. For example:

The programmer spent the morning debugging the new app.
